etymologies: mid 19th century: from Greek pektos ‘congealed’ (from pēgnuein ‘make solid’) + -in

definitions: a soluble gelatinous polysaccharide that is present in ripe fruits and is extracted for use as a setting agent in jams and jellies

examples.text: the very early stalks may not have quite enough natural pectin to set properly
two common types of soluble fiber are pectins and gums

shortDefinitions: soluble gelatinous polysaccharide which is present in ripe fruits and is used as setting agent
